issue.title: AVX2 support for Sphincs
issue.body:
Fixes #1249. Improves / builds on #1420,

- correcting documentation
- adding AVX2 support for Sphincs (with suitable patchfile)
- excluding new aarch64 upstream code package

* [Yes] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [Yes] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: This PR is arguably superseded by #1460 (and may be closed if that PR is merged).

issue.title: removing Kyber90s, DilithiumAES
issue.body:
Fixes #1417

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [yes] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

Please note that this code is used to prepare downstream PRs for merging #1420. 

Actual code changes are not part of this PR to not cause unnecessary conflicts in #1420. 

The idea is to merge this PR only when all issues in #1420 are resolved: Please merge this PR, rebase #1420 on this and run `copy_from_upstream` as a final step in #1420 to trigger the actual algorithm removal (or just update the 3 file contents in #1420 -- whatever is easier).

@dstebila As I assume you will do the final merge of #1420, please let me know how you want to proceed. Until then, leaving this at Draft state.

comment.body: This PR is arguably superseded by #1460 (and may be closed if that PR is merged).

issue.title: Add h2load to oqs-demos
issue.body:
Hi, I integrated openssl v3 and oqs-provider into h2load benchmarking tool and provided a Dockerfile to fully automate the integration.

Thanks for reviewing!

comment.body: I think it'd be nice to figure out what the source of the segfaults is before we merge it in, if only to preclude people posting issues about failures they encounter.

comment.body:
@baentsch to avoid duplicating work I thought I'd note here I'm going to work on:

1. Merging in the clean variants of SPHINCS into liboqs in with the name changes
2. Fixing the downstream breakages
3. Adding in the AVX2 versions to liboqs

comment.body:
> @baentsch to avoid duplicating work I thought I'd note here I'm going to work on:
> 
>     1. Merging in the clean variants of SPHINCS into liboqs in with the name changes
> 
>     2. Fixing the downstream breakages
> 
>     3. Adding in the AVX2 versions to liboqs

Well I just read #1460 and I think I understand what's going on there.  And between #1460 and #1420, that would accomplish everything on your list except for the algorithm name changes.  So maybe it would save work to follow Michael's plan of merging #1460 into #1420 and then #1420 into main?  The only question would then be whether we do the SPHINCS+ name changes before merging #1420 into main or afterwards.  In the interests of keeping the commits smaller (already #1460+1420 will be pretty big) I'd say we do the name changes after merging 1420.

issue.title: Add h2load to oqs-demos
issue.body:
Hi, I integrated openssl v3 and oqs-provider into h2load benchmarking tool and provided a Dockerfile to fully automate the integration.

Thanks for reviewing!

comment.body:
> I think it'd be nice to figure out what the source of the segfaults is before we merge it in, if only to preclude people posting issues about failures they encounter.

Nice, yes, but does anyone of us have time for this? We're already a month late with v0.8.0... 

So, I'd be willing to take the risk of such questions. If a single one comes, I'd be surprised -- and add a note to the README :)

comment.body:
> The only question would then be whether we do the SPHINCS+ name changes before merging https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1420 into main or afterwards. In the interests of keeping the commits smaller (already https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1460+1420 will be pretty big) I'd say we do the name changes after merging 1420.

Good for me (big surprise :). This will allow https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/158 to run right away (doing a full downstream test).
